data.title: The Chakri Dynasty of Thailand Quiz
data.meta_description: The Chakri Dynasty first took the throne of Thailand then Siam in 1782. Can you match up the first ten kings of the dynasty with the correct facts about their reign? The full names of these kings can be lengthy, so common short forms are given.
data.text: QuestionsChoices 1. Led his country into the First World War. Started the tradition of referring to the Chakri monarchs as 'King Rama'. Rama VIII - Ananda Mahidol 2. Renamed the reigns of the Chakri monarchs to avoid his being known as the "Late Reign". Ordered the destruction of Vientiane following Anouvong's Rebellion. Rama X - Vajiralongkorn 3. Became king aged 64 - the oldest of the first ten Chakri kings on ascending the throne. Delayed accepting it for 50 days in order to mourn his father's death. Rama V - Chulalongkorn 4. Succeeded to the throne at the age of nine. Died in mysterious circumstances of a gunshot wound to the head at the age of 20. Rama II - Nabhalai 5. Spent 27 years as a monk before ascending to the throne. Famous for employing an English governess for his children and was the titular king in the musical 'The King and I'. Rama VII - Prajadhipok 6. Led his country during the Nine Armies' War with Burma and was responsible for making Bangkok its capital city. Rama VI - Vajiravudh 7. Was the country's last absolute monarch and first constitutional one. Abdicated the throne and spent the rest of his life in England. Rama IV - Mongkut 8. Set a new record for the longest serving Thai monarch when he died after 70 years and 126 days on the throne. During that time the country's name changed from Siam to Thailand. Rama I - Chulalok 9. A peaceful king who championed the arts and promoted the practice of Buddhism. His reign is known as the "Golden Age of Rattanakosin Literature". Rama IX - Bhumibol Adulyadej
